info.title: Mantis Bug Tracker REST API
info.description:
Mantis Bug Tracker (MantisHub) REST APIs.

REST API calls have to be authenticated by creating an API token for the user doing the calls, and then passing the API token in the 'Authorization' header.  However, for anonymous access, the API key and header are not needed.  

Postman Environment Variables:
- {{token}} - The API token to be used for authentication.
- {{url}} - The base URL for Mantis instance (e.g. 'https://instance-name.mantishub.io').

There has been significant improvements and feature additions for REST API in each of the recent releases.  Hence, it is highly recommended to use latest release when leveraging the REST APIs.

REST API is enabled by default since MantisBT 2.8.0 release.

get.description:
Get issue with the specified id.

Available since MantisBT 2.3.0.  Issue history included since MantisBT 2.9.0.

patch.description:
Update an exiting issue.

Available since MantisBT 2.8.0.

example.message: Access denied for user GermanReporter. Reason: Not enough rights to update issues.

requestBody.description:
Update an exiting issue.

Available since MantisBT 2.8.0.

delete.description:
Deletes an issue given its id.

Available since MantisBT 2.3.0.

get.description:
Get all files associated with an issue.

Available since MantisBT 2.11.0.

parameters.description: The issue id to get files for

Available since MantisBT 2.11.0.

get.description:
Get a single file from an issue.

Available since MantisBT 2.11.0.

Get paginated list of issues.

Available since MantisBT 2.3.0.  Issue history included since MantisBT 2.9.0.  A fix was implemented in 2.20.0 to avoid filtering out of some issues (e.g. closed issues).

projects.name: mantisbt
projects.description: Mantis.  Report problems with the actual bug tracker here. (Do not remove this account)

versions.description:
MantisBT 1.2.20 is the final maintenance and security release for the 1.2.x series. 
All installations that are currently running any 1.2.x version are strongly advised to upgrade. 

This release resolves 3 security and a couple of PHP 7 compatibility issues.

versions.name: 2.0.0-beta.1
versions.description: MantisBT 2.0.0 release focuses on improvements to the UI compared to 1.3.x release. As of this release, the db schema is the same between 1.3.x and 2.0.0-beta.1, enabling users to easily try 2.0.0-beta.1 and provide feedback.

versions.name: Backlog
versions.description: Issues accepted but not yet assigned to a release.

parameters.name: user_id

get.description:
Get specified config option.  If an option doesn't exist or is marked as private, it will be silently skipped.

Some config options get extra handling to provide more useful response.  For example:

- Enumerations - The enumeration is parsed into an array of objects, each object including id, name and localized label.

For list of possible config options to retrieve see the following file:
https://github.com/mantisbt/mantisbt/blob/master/config_defaults_inc.php

When requesting an option, don't supply the `$g_` prefix for the string name.  Only options that are listed as public can be retrieved via this API.  Search the `config_defaults_inc.php` file for `$g_public_config_names` to see the list of public options.

Available since MantisBT 2.3.0.

Get the specified localized string.  If string doesn't exist, it will be silently skipped.

For list of possible strings to retrieve see the following file:
https://github.com/mantisbt/mantisbt/blob/master/lang/strings_english.txt

When requesting a string, don't supply the `$s_` prefix for the string name.

IN DEVELOPMENT - NOT RELEASED YET!

Get information necessary to render an issue view page for the specified issue.

page_size.name: page_size
page_size.description: The number of issues to return per page.  Default is 50 but overridable by configuration.

message.default: Access denied for user GermanReporter. Reason: Not enough rights to update issues.
